group_1.narration: As the dawn broke,@the merry-go-round stopped moving,@and we left the town.
I don't know why it stopped.@It just halted abruptly, as if the magic@had been broken with the sunrise,@and we never saw it again.
It's as if...@Hanna wanted to keep its beautiful lights@as a memory of that night only.
―Hanna―@I wonder if the guys in that town are making a fuss?@The bombs are still there.
―Mikoto―@But they're fake, right?
―Hanna―@They're fake, but...@they look exactly like real pipe bombs.
―Mikoto―@Well, it might surprise someone if they see@something like that placed meaningfully.
―Hanna―@Surprisingly enough...@Our revenge seems kinda small.
It might seem small, but...@it's a fact that we're causing trouble for others.
But this is the only way we know how to live.
We've been walking on the rails of not being normal...@and we'll continue until the end...
―Mikoto―@...Right, let's plant these seeds.
I took snowdrop seeds from the bag@and planted them on the rails with Hanna,@bidding farewell to the longing for a normal life...
―Mikoto―@Speaking of which...you made the people of that town@forget about us with suggestion magic, right?
―Hanna―@That's for the best, isn't it?
―Hanna―@It's enough if only we remember ourselves...@The rest, well, let it be.
―Hanna―@...Maybe just these flowers?
I imagined snowdrops blooming@at the end of winter.
The sight of pure white flowers blooming in a steady stream,@as if to prove our footsteps...
―Mikoto―@I didn't really say it properly, but...
―Hanna―@Yeah...?

group_1.textCenter: I'm really glad I met you...
I'm alive in this world because of you.
Even in a world like this, I still want to live.
Hey Hanna, don't leave me this time.
